headline.main: National Briefing | Washington: Veto Threat On Base Closings

lead_paragraph: Secretary of Defense Donald H. Rumsfeld threatened a presidential veto of the defense authorization bill if House negotiators on a conference report continued to resist new base-closing authority for the department. In a letter to Senator Carl Levin, the Michigan Democrat who is chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, Mr. Rumsfeld wrote that keeping unneeded bases ''is unfair to the taxpayer and diverts resources that would be better applied to our war fighters.'' The Senate voted to include in its bill a provision for a new round of base closings. The House bill had no such measure. Adam Clymer (NYT)
